elements.title: Phomen Singh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Phomen Singh (pictured), an early Indian migrant to New Zealand, sold sweets and chutneys out of a suitcase?

elements.title: Ephelcomenus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the artiodactyl Ephelcomenus is thought to have been capable of burrowing?

elements.title: Nadezhda Bantle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Nadezhda Bantle was exiled to the Russian North, she oversaw the development of the hospital in Nikolskoye to become the most advanced in its region?

elements.title: Baldwin–Reynolds House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the design of the Baldwin–Reynolds House, a mansion built for U.S. Supreme Court justice Henry Baldwin, may have been inspired by Andrew Jackson's home?

elements.title: Vincent Marks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that pathologist Vincent Marks helped reverse the conviction of socialite Claus von Bülow in a case that was adapted for the film Reversal of Fortune?

elements.title: a school for African-American students in Virginia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that enrollment at a school for African-American students in Virginia grew from 14 pupils to 1,300 in its first ten years?

elements.title: George Daniel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Daniel submitted his band's demos as coursework while in college?

elements.title: Free and Candid Disquisitions (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the only proposal from the 1749 book Free and Candid Disquisitions to be implemented by the Church of England was a prayer "for the ceasing of the distemper" of cattle?
